title: Rebuilding and Enhancing Programs To Resettle Refugees and Planning for the Impact of Climate Change on Migration

enrichment.summary: This order directs the Biden Administration to rebuild and expand the United States Refugee Admissions Program, improving efficiency, fairness, and security in refugee processing while ensuring humane treatment of applicants. It also mandates reviews of special immigrant visa programs for Iraqi and Afghan allies and requires a report on the impacts of climate change on migration to inform future policy responses.
potential_concerns: Rebuilding and expanding USRAP could face logistical and resource challenges, causing delays despite intentions to reduce them.
Enhanced vetting and fraud detection measures may inadvertently slow processing or create barriers for vulnerable applicants.
Efforts to publicly share detailed visa and refugee policies might raise privacy concerns or risk misuse of sensitive information.
Identifying and defining climate-driven migrants for protection lacks clear international standards, complicating policy implementation.
Legislative or bureaucratic hurdles could delay necessary reforms in Special Immigrant Visa programs despite review requirements.
